channel.title: BBC News

item.title: BBC finds Lebanese seaside city deserted after Israeli attacks
item.description: Correspondent Orla Guerin reports on airstrikes and evacuations in the southern city of Tyre.

item.title: 'Lambs to the slaughter' - former Harrods staff detail decades of abuse by Fayed
item.description: Five women who accuse the late billionaire of sex attacks have shared their stories with BBC Breakfast.

item.title: Unions win non-binding vote calling on Labour to scrap winter fuel payment cuts
item.description: Keir Starmer defended the move in his conference speech on Tuesday, but Unite boss says it is "wrong".

item.title: I won't back down on broken NHS claims - Streeting
item.description: Health secretary comes out fighting after BBC reveals there is growing unease in NHS about approach.

item.title: Europe’s deadly floods are glimpse of future climate
item.description: A new study shows that the record-breaking rainfall was made more likely and intense by climate change.

item.title: Phillip Schofield to make TV comeback
item.description: The 62-year-old will appear in Channel 5’s Cast Away which sees him stranded on an island for 10 days.

item.title: Sickness benefit claimants should look for work, says PM
item.description: The prime minister has said the public will have to make "trade-offs" if the country is to improve.

item.title: The town pushing to delay smartphones for children
item.description: William Ransom Primary School is inviting all the towns schools to join their smartphone pledge.

item.title: Bowen: Israel is gambling Hezbollah will crumple but it faces a well-armed, angry enemy
item.description: The Lebanese armed group has - like Israel - spent years preparing and is more formidable than Hamas in Gaza.

item.title: Huel hit with third ad ban in two months
item.description: The meal supplement company made misleading claims comparing its product to vegetables.

item.title: Ex-police officer wins £1.1m after discrimination
item.description: Thames Valley Police told Katrina Hibbert she must stop running a party business, a tribunal hears.

item.title: Timeline of sex abuse allegations
item.description: Here are some of the key moments and sex abuse claims amid Fayed’s almost 40-year reign at the top of his business empire.

item.title: Fayed accusers subjected to 'intrusive tests' to complain about doctor
item.description: At least two doctors are reported to have carried out the examinations, including invasive sexual health tests.

item.title: How the BBC uncovered abuse allegations against the Harrods boss
item.description: Five women who worked at the luxury store say they were raped by the billionaire - BBC documentary reveals.

item.title: The culture of fear that protected a predator
item.description: One woman says the head of security for the former Harrods boss threatened her when she tried to speak out.

item.title: Watch on iPlayer
item.description: A BBC investigation into allegations of rape and attempted rape by Mohamed Al Fayed, the former owner of Harrods. Did the luxury store protect a billionaire predator?

item.title: What is the PR strategy behind Phillip Schofield's TV comeback?
item.description: The presenter's decision to appear in Channel 5's Cast Away could pave the way for a long-term return.

item.title: An 11th lawsuit for Sean 'Diddy' Combs as he sits in jail
item.description: Criminal charges against the 54-year-old could land him in prison - and the list of accusers is growing.

item.title: US election polls: Who is ahead - Harris or Trump?
item.description: An in-depth look at the polls and what they can and can’t tell us about who will win the White House.

item.title: Why artist collabs are more popular than ever
item.description: Fall Out Boy, Neck Deep and Ella Henderson explain why teaming up with artists is such an attractive choice.

item.title: Ian Rankin: How the death of my mum led me to Rebus
item.description: The Rebus author says his writing style darkened after his mother died when he was just 19.

item.title: Will the US presidential election define the future of crypto?
item.description: Crypto currency firms are waiting to see how November's vote will impact upon them.

item.title: Pakistan's female doctors reveal why they don't feel safe at work
item.description: Women working in Pakistan’s hospitals say they face sexual harassment, violence and verbal abuse.

item.title: Son gave hospital ‘clear evidence’ his mum planned to take her own life
item.description: Christopher MacRae's mother Sara died at the Royal Edinburgh psychiatric hospital in March 2020.

item.title: UK shouldn't shun Shein, says ex-B&Q boss
item.description: Chinese firm Shein should list in London despite controversy over green credentials, Sir Ian Cheshire says.

item.title: Missouri executes Marcellus Williams after two decades on death row
item.description: Marcellus Williams had long proclaimed he was innocent in the 1998 fatal stabbing of Felicia Gayle in a St Louis, Missouri, suburb.

item.title: James McAvoy and Tom Brady fall for 'Goodbye Meta AI' hoax
item.description: More than 600,000 people have shared a message falsely denying Meta the right to use their images to train AI.

item.title: One in three children is short-sighted, global study suggests
item.description: There was a notable rise after Covid when children spent less time outdoors, researchers say.

item.title: More women accuse tribunal judge of bullying
item.description: Three more women accuse an employment tribunal judge of bullying during hearings.

item.title: UK economic growth 'robust' in 2024, think tank says
item.description: A think tank says it expects UK economic growth grow by 1.1%, the same rate as Canada and France.

item.title: Starmer's tunnel vision
item.description: The PM promises light at the end of the proverbial

item.title: America and... the World
item.description: What is the US relationship with the world today and how would Trump and Harris shape it?

item.title: Man City confirm Rodri has injured knee ligament
item.description: Manchester City confirm Spain midfielder Rodri suffered a knee ligament injury against Arsenal on Sunday.

item.title: From 'little doubts' to topping table - Adams on Torino move
item.description: Che Adams had "little doubts" about moving his life to Italy - but the Scotland striker is at the top of Serie A with Torino.

item.title: Real Madrid confirm Mbappe has suffered thigh injury
item.description: Real Madrid forward Kylian Mbappe faces a spell on the sidelines because of a thigh injury suffered in a win against Deportivo Alaves on Tuesday.

item.title: Red Roses don't deserve low crowds - coach Mitchell
item.description: John Mitchell says that his England team deserve more than 'non-crowds' as concerns grow over ticket sales at the WXV tournament in Canada

item.title: Ex-Real Madrid & Man Utd defender Varane retires aged 31
item.description: Former Manchester United, Real Madrid and France defender Raphael Varane retires from football at the age of 31.

item.title: Australia beat England to seal series win
item.description: Australia seal victory in their three-Test series against England after winning the decider 69-56 in Bendigo, Victoria.

item.title: Ex-police officer wins £1.1m after discrimination
item.description: Thames Valley Police told Katrina Hibbert she must stop running a party business, a tribunal hears.

item.title: 'Disgusting' drug dealing in hospital condemned
item.description: The Belfast health trust says increased drug taking and dealing on its sites is a worrying trend.

item.title: Legal challenge to Rosebank oil field given go-ahead
item.description: Greenpeace and Uplift have brought judicial reviews to stop the development of Rosebank oil field and Jackdaw gas field.

item.title: Man dies after being hit with bottle in Prague
item.description: Dai Richards is described as a good man, a father, a son and a brother.
